titleStmt.title: C. D. Gooch et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG7272

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p: To his Excellency the Govenor of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Madison county Ky represent unto your excellency that William Logston & James F M Coyle were this day fined twenty dollars each by John W. Harcourt a justice of the peace in and for Madison county for a breech of the peace in the town of Richmond
The evidence did not show that any injury had been done to any person The parties have the character of peaceabley orderly men and good citizens and accidentally became intoxicated
Logston has very lately returned from several years service in the federal army ^(4th Ky I V)^ The parties are poor and we believe will not transgress in a similar manner any more
We therefore earnestly petition your excellency to remit the whole of the fine against each of the parties. November 1st 1865

C D Gooch
John J. Cornelison
S Tourner
& Krell
Cuzich
T. J. Scott Atty at Law
Jas M Kindred S. M. C
David Russell formerly capt 21st Ky
Charlie C. Taylor
John, G, Taylor
John Farley
G W Lewis D S M C
J. E Kindred
Wm C Wilson D S M C
Jno P Guinn formerly capt 8th Ky I. V.
G B Broaddess ^formerly^ Major 8th Ky I. V.
B H Sale formelry Lieut 8th Ky I. V.
J H Berry

Richmond City Ct
vs
W. Logston, J. Francis and M Coyle
Madison
